trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Cheery Flavor
entries: This creature taste like cherry albeit a bit more acidic, biting in radical fashion will likely result in {@damage 1d4} acid damage to your throat

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the slime takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Body Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Suffocate
entries: The Slime try to wrap itself on enemy head to suffocate them, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength or Dexterity saving throw or take  {@damage 1d6} Damage, per turn it stays there

A jelly like creature, some say it's weaker than a cat but don't be fooled, those shiny and bubbly body can stretch and bend like crazy making it hard to hit if it's aware of you, often called as Puni, Poring, or just slime

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage.
Mind flayers unleash all manner of foul experiments upon the planes with little thought for the consequences. Here, though, I suspect another influence: Juiblex.

entries.name: Oblex Spawn
entries: An oblex devours memories not only to sustain its existence, but also to spawn new oblexes. Each time it fully drains the memories of a victim, it gains the creature's personality—now twisted by the oblex's foul nature. The more memories an oblex steals, the larger it becomes, until it must shed a personality it has absorbed or else go insane. This act spawns a new oblex.

entries.name: Oblex
entries: By experimenting on the slimes, jellies, and puddings that infest the depths of the Underdark, mind flayers created a special breed of ooze, the oblex—a slime capable of assaulting the minds of other creatures. Cunning hunters, these pools of jelly stalk prey, searching for the memories they so desperately crave. When oblexes feed on those thoughts, sometimes killing their victims, they can form weird copies of their prey, which help them to harvest even more victims for their dark masters.

entries.name: Memory Eaters
entries: Oblexes feed on thoughts and memories. The sharper the mind, the better the meal, so oblexes hunt obviously intelligent targets such as wizards and other spellcasters. When suitable fare comes within reach, an oblex draws its body up to engulf its victim. As it withdraws, it plunders the creature's mind, leaving its prey befuddled and confused.

entries.name: Ooze Nature
entries: An oblex doesn't require sleep.

An oblex wants memories, but not to serve any end of its own making. Oblexes are hungry for memories and personalities because they are empty without such nourishment. In this way they serve their creators, the illithids. An oblex in the range of an elder brain's powers provides everything necessary for the mind flayers to find choice victims.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Strong Acid
entries: his creature taste like nothing, when you bite to it, the sensation you feel is just burning akin to licking strong sulfuric acid, the aftertaste will leave your tongue numb, but it's smells like pinewood and grass, biting it, whether in radical or orderly fashion will always result in {@damage 1d8} acid damage to your throat and mouth, you might want to process it before consuming it

trait.name: Unstable Chemistry
entries: If the slime takes fire damage, it could explode maybe

action.name: Stationary Fire / Multiattack
entries: if the acid slime does not move, it could do acid spit twice

action.name: Body Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. + {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) acid damage.

A jelly like creature, some say it's weaker than a cat but don't be fooled, those shiny and bubbly body can stretch and bend like crazy making it hard to hit if it's aware of you, often called as Puni, Poring, or just slime

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the Branchleg moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Living Plants
entries: The Branchleg regains 8 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the Branchleg's next turn. The Branchleg dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vine Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

The majestic giant elk is rare to the point that its appearance is often taken as a foreshadowing of an important event, such as the birth of a king. Legends tell of gods that take the form of giant elk when visiting the Material Plane. Many cultures therefore believe that to hunt these creatures is to invite divine wrath.

monster.name: Bush Imp
languages: one language known by its creator

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the Bush Imp remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal shrub.

action.name: Rake
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) slashing damage.
An awakened shrub is an ordinary shrub given sentience and mobility by the awaken spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the dolphin moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.
Dolphins are clever, social marine mammals that feed on small fish and squid. An adult specimen is between 5 and 6 feet long.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The crab can breathe air and water.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The shark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

Smaller than a giant shark but larger and fiercer than a reef shark, a hunter shark haunts deep waters. It usually hunts alone, but multiple hunter sharks might feed in the same area. A fully grown hunter shark is 15 to 20 feet long.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The whale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The whale has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the snake can't constrict another target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the snake can't constrict another target.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: The Nature of Swarms
entries: The swarms presented here aren't ordinary or benign assemblies of little creatures. They form as a result of some sinister or unwholesome influence. A vampire can summon swarms of bats and rats from the darkest corners of the night, while the very presence of a mummy lord can cause scarab beetles to boil up from the sand-filled depths of its tomb. A hag might have the power to turn swarms of ravens against her enemies, while a yuan-ti abomination might have swarms of poisonous snakes slithering in its wake. Even druids can't charm these swarms, and their aggressiveness is borderline unnatural.

trait.name: Feline Agility
entries: When the tabaxi moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed until the end of the turn. Once it uses this ability, the tabaxi can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Ranger Companion : Ratthew
entries: Add your proficiency bonus to the beast's AC, attack rolls, and damage rolls, as well as to any saving throws and skills it is proficient in. Its hit point maximum equals its normal maximum or four times your ranger level, whichever is higher. Like any creature, the beast can spend Hit Dice during a short rest.

The beast obeys your commands as best as it can. It takes its turn on your initiative. On your turn, you can verbally command the beast where to move (no action required by you). You can use your action to verbally command it to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage, or Help action. If you don't issue a command, the beast takes the Dodge action. Once you have the Extra Attack feature, you can make one weapon attack yourself when you command the beast to take the Attack action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tabaxi makes two attacks with its claws, its shortsword, or its shortbow.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4}+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

Tabaxi are catfolk who hail from the land of Maztica. The ultimate wanderers, Tabaxi rarely stay in one place for long. They love to collect interesting artifacts, gather tales, and lay eyes on all the world's wonders. This curiosity pushes them to leave no secrets uncovered, and no treasures or legends lost. They revere a fickle deity called the Cat Lord, who is said to wander the world.

Tabaxi hunters are trained to survive in the wild, making them excellent guides. Tabaxi minstrels gather in small troupes and make themselves at home in any settlement, earning coin through music and storytelling.

entries.name: Names
entries: A tabaxi typically has a single name, determined by his or her clan and based on a complex formula involving astrology, prophecy, clan history, and other factors. Male and female tabaxi use the same names, and most use nicknames derived from or inspired by their full names. Tabaxi clan names are usually based on a geographical feature located in or near a clan's territory. Sample tabaxi names include Nest of Eggs ("Eggs"), Dead Leaf ("Leaf"), Eyes of Onyx ("Onyx"), Lost Spear ("Lost"), and Daylight Moon ("Moon"). Clan names include Distant Rain, Hundred Feathers, Sleeping Creek, Bright Cliffs, and Snoring Mountain.

trait.name: Feline Agility
entries: When the tabaxi moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed until the end of the turn. Once it uses this ability, the tabaxi can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, you can deal an extra  ({{@dice 2d6}}) damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

You gain an additional way to use your Cunning Action: carefully aiming your next attack. As a bonus action, you give yourself advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

trait.name: Fast Hands
entries: you can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock, or take the Use an Object action.

trait.name: Second-Story Work
entries: you gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs you extra movement.
In addition, when you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tabaxi makes two attacks with its claws, its shortsword, or its shortbow.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4}+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Chef Knives
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.
A knive as big as a short sword. what a wild cat

action.name: Hand Crossbow

They revere a fickle deity called the Cat Lord, who is said to wander the world.

Tabaxi hunters are trained to survive in the wild, making them excellent guides. Tabaxi minstrels gather in small troupes and make themselves at home in any settlement, earning coin through music and storytelling.

Tabaxi clan names are usually based on a geographical feature located in or near a clan's territory. Sample tabaxi names include Nest of Eggs ("Eggs"), Dead Leaf ("Leaf"), Eyes of Onyx ("Onyx"), Lost Spear ("Lost"), and Daylight Moon ("Moon"). Clan names include Distant Rain, Hundred Feathers, Sleeping Creek, Bright Cliffs, and Snoring Mountain.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The rat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The rat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the rat's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

variant.name: Diseased Giant Rats
entries: Some giant rats carry vile diseases that they spread with their bites.

entries.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or contract a disease. Until the disease is cured, the target can't regain hit points except by magical means, and the target's hit point maximum decreases by 3 ({@dice 1d6}) every 24 hours. If the target's hit point maximum drops to 0 as a result of this disease, the target dies.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The Branchleg has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Branchleg regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the Branchleg's next turn. The Branchleg dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Branchleg makes two attacks with its claws or two melee attacks with its spear.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Living Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Spores (1/Day)
entries: A 15-foot-radius cloud of toxic spores extends out from the Branchleg. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in that area that isn't a plant must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a target takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Vegepygmies are fungus creatures that live in simple tribal units, hunting for sustenance and spreading the spores from which they reproduce.

entries.name: Primitive Plants
entries: Vegepygmies, also called mold folk or moldies, inhabit dark areas that are warm and wet, so they are most commonly found underground or in dense forests where little sunlight penetrates. A vegepygmy instinctively feels kinship with other plant and fungus creatures, and thus vegepygmy tribes coexist well with creatures such as myconids, shriekers, and violet fungi.

Although they prefer to eat fresh meat, bone, and blood, vegepygmies can absorb nutrients from soil and many sorts of organic matter, meaning that they rarely go hungry. A vegepygmy can hiss and make other noises by forcing air through its mouth, but it can't speak in a conventional sense. Among themselves, vegepygmies communicate by hissing, gestures, and rhythmic tapping on the body. Vegepygmies build and craft little; any gear they have is acquired from other creatures or built by copying simple construction they have witnessed.

As a vegepygmy ages, it grows tougher and develops spore clusters on its body. Spore-bearing vegepygmies are deferred to by other vegepygmies, so outsiders refer to such vegepygmies as chiefs. A chief can expel its spores in a burst, infecting nearby creatures. If a creature dies while infected, its corpse produces vegepygmies the same way russet mold does.

No one knows for sure where russet mold came from. One historical account tells of adventurers in a forbidding mountain range discovering russet mold and vegepygmies in a peculiar metal dungeon full of strange life. Another story says that explorers found russet mold in a crater left by a falling star, with vegepygmies infesting the dense jungle nearby.

entries.name: Mold Begets Mold
entries: Vegepygmies originate from the remains left behind when a humanoid or a giant is killed by russet mold. One or more vegepygmies emerge from the corpse a day later. If a beast such as a dog or a bear dies from russet mold, the result is a bestial moldie called a thorny result instead of a humanoid-shaped vegepygmy. Thornies are less intelligent than vegepygmies, but have greater size and ferocity, as well as a thorn-covered body.

entries.name: Russet Mold
entries: The fungus known as russet mold is reddish-brown in color and found only in places that are dark, warm, and wet. Russet mold that spreads out across a metal object can be mistaken for natural rust, and a successful DC 15 Intelligence (Nature) or Wisdom (Survival) check is required to identify it accurately by sight in such a case.

Any creature that comes within 5 feet of russet mold must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw as the mold emits a puff of spores. On a failed save, the creature becomes poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the creature takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns, sprouting mold as it takes damage. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any magic that neutralizes poison or cures disease kills the infestation. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the mold's poison damage dies. If the dead creature is a beast, a giant, or a humanoid, one or more newborn vegepygmies emerge from its body 24 hours later: one newborn from a Small corpse, two from a Medium corpse, four from a Large corpse, eight from a Huge corpse, or sixteen from a Gargantuan corpse.

Russet mold can be hard to kill, since weapons and most types of damage do it no harm. Effects that deal acid, necrotic, or radiant damage kill 1 square foot of russet mold per 1 damage dealt. A pound of salt, a gallon of alcohol, or a magical effect that cures disease kills russet mold in a square area that is 10 feet on a side. Sunlight kills any russet mold in the light's area.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The Branchleg has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Branchleg regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the Branchleg's next turn. The Branchleg dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Living Spear
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.
Vegepygmies are fungus creatures that live in simple tribal units, hunting for sustenance and spreading the spores from which they reproduce.

monster.name: Mini Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a {@dc 15} Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mending Magic
entries: The Golem regains 4 hit points at the start of its turn. this trait doesn't function if the Golem has less than 50% of it's HP.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Strike as One !
entries: Once per turn, the Goblin Warlord  can deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Golin Warlord makes three melee attacks. Alternatively, it can make two ranged attacks with its javelins.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Commanding Presence
entries: Once Per Turn, the Warlord can sacrifice any goblin to make any goblin that can hear and see it within 30 feet get advantage on it's action.
"GET YOUR LEGS MOVING YOU SHIT STAINED MAGGOT, OR YOU'RE NEXT"

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The hobgoblin adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the hobgoblin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the Goblin Warband can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the Goblin that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Goblin Warband makes two Great Axe attacks.

action.name: Great Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Brutal Command (Recharges on 6)
entries: For 1 minute, the Warband can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the hobgoblin. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the hobgoblin is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Knives
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stone
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Grom is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Wicked Spell
entries: Once per turn, the Grom can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a damaging spell attack if that target is within 5 feet of an ally and that ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Army Arcana
entries: When the Grom casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

trait.name: Chariot Ride
entries: Grom by default is riding a chariot pulled by 2 warg.
his speed is 40ft

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Eat Up ! NOM NOM NOM!
entries: Grom can eat his own kind an heal him for 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Health Points

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Goblin Rabids hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Goblin Rabids can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of his turns.

action.name: Multi Attack
entries: Goblin Rabids makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Goblin Mage innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). they can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Dark One's Blessing
entries: When Goblin Mages reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points, she gains 6 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Goblin Mages can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

trait.name: Dark Portals
entries: Goblin Mages can opt out it's action to channel dark portal from beyond to call more goblins, up to  ({@damage 1d3}) goblin per turn

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Goblin Mages makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) force damage.

trait.name: Deformed Creature
entries: The troll has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell and sight.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Goblin troll regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Mounted Beast
entries: If any smaller goblin mounted the Goblin Troll, The penalty of Deformity is nullified and it's has advantage on it's attack.
The Smaller Goblin will lose it's action for automatic help action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Goblin Troll makes Two attacks: one with its bite and One with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Shared Bonds
entries: The Goblins and The Wolf soul has been bonded together, if one dies, the other dies.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Goblin Wolfrider can do two attack, one bite and one scimitar

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Special : Man the Ballista
entries: Forfeit it's action to control the Ballista,
{@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 60ft/120ft, one target.
{@h}24 ({@damage 6d8}) piercing damage, If hits, The target must succeed a {@dc 12} DEX or STR Saving Throw, If fails the target are {@condition restrained} by the ballista's Bolt.
Creature can shake the {@condition restrained} condition by doing a {@dc 14} Dex or Str saving throw on it's turn as an action, to unpin themself.

trait.name: Flaming Arrow
entries: One way or another this little creature has added exploding and flammable tips to their arrows

action.name: Flimsy Goblin Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) fire damage.

trait.name: Packed with Explosive
entries: This goblin is carrying a loads of explosive, if it dies it will explode in 10ft radius dealing ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage and ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage, it will lit flammable things and break fragile stuff.

trait.name: Who told you bringing explosive into battlefield is a good idea ?
entries: when attacked by any fire or lightning damage, the firestarter has to do a  ({@damage 1d8}) roll, ending in 1 or 2 make it explode prematurely.

trait.name: Fuggin Flingin' Firestick
entries: Is that a nat 1 on swinging the firestick? yeap, it swung back to the explosive barrel on it's back, good job goblin.
nat 1 will cause Packed With Explosive Trait to Be active Prematurely

action.name: Firestick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) fire damage.

action.name: Stone
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.
